node.title: FOI documents reveal Australia's Future Fund invests $150m in companies linked to Myanmar military
node.alt: A group of soldiers carrying bayonets while wearing maroon berets
node.description: Myanmar's civilian government in exile has criticised Australia's sovereign wealth fund for investing in several companies — including weapons manufacturers — that have done business with Myanmar's military.
node.content:
["Myanmar's civilian government in exile has criticised Australia's sovereign wealth fund for investing in several companies \u2014\u00a0including weapons manufacturers \u2014 that\u00a0have done business with Myanmar's military.", "Advocacy groups say the military has killed more than 1,000 civilians since it ousted Aung San Suu Kyi and seized power in February this year, while the International Criminal Court is probing whether it committed genocide against the Rohingya minority ethnic group.", "Documents obtained under Freedom of Information laws by activists reveal that the Future Fund holds just under $158 million in 14 public companies with links to Myanmar's military \u2014\u00a0known as the Tatmadaw \u2014\u00a0including an arms manufacturer that\u00a0has sold fighter jets and other weapons to the junta.", "Minister for Finance in Myanmar's National Unity Government (NUG)\u00a0U Tin Tun Naing\u00a0said the Future Fund was supporting companies that\u00a0had profited from the suffering of people in his country.", "\"We would like to request the Australian government and the Future Fund to stop this support \u2014\u00a0they are helping the military to survive while they commit these violent acts [towards]\u00a0their own citizens.\"", "The minister said the arrest of Australian economist Sean Turnell \u2014\u00a0who is still languishing in jail several months after his arrest \u2014\u00a0also highlighted the urgent need for the Future Fund to ensure it wasn't investing in companies that\u00a0were helping to prop-up the regime.", "", "
Australian economist Sean Turnell, pictured with his wife Ha Vu, has been detained in Myanmar since the February coup.(Supplied)
", "The FOI documents show that the Future Fund \u2014\u00a0which holds investments worth just under $200 billion dollars \u2014\u00a0has invested around $5 million in subsidiaries of Aviation Industry Corporation of China (AVIC), which researchers say has sold short-range missiles, long-range missiles and combat aircraft to the military junta.", "Australia's Future Fund has also invested almost $18 million in Indian defence firm Bharat Electronics, which has sold sonar, radar and other surveillance systems to the Tatmadaw.", "U Tin Tun Naing said international firms supplying the military junta with either weapons \u2014\u00a0or propping-up the regime through their investments \u2014\u00a0were undermining domestic attempts to starve the regime of cash and legitimacy.", "", "
Myanmar's citizens continue\u00a0to protest against military rule.(Reuters)
", "\"If we can cut off international investment, the military cannot survive. That is why we are requesting international businesses, deeply from our heart, to divest and [stop]\u00a0their engagement with the military,\" he said.", "A spokesperson for Justice For Myanmar, Yadanar Maung, also said that the Future Fund investments were \"deplorable\" and accused it of \"seeking to profit from companies arming the Myanmar military and effectively financing its campaign of terror\".\u00a0", "\"In the name of Australia's 'future', taxpayer funds are being invested in companies that supply the Myanmar military with fighter jets, missiles, radar and provide millions in annual revenue to war criminals,\" they said.", "", "
The Tatmadaw has been accused of genocide against Myanmar's Rohingya population, forcing many to flee to refugee camp Cox's Bazar in Bangladesh.\u00a0(UNHCR: Andrew McConnell)
", "A spokesperson from the Australian Future Fund said it had\u00a0built a portfolio that\u00a0includes \"passive investments\".\u00a0", "\"In line with its mandate from government, the Future Fund has built a broadly diversified portfolio [that]\u00a0includes passive investments through thousands of entities globally,\" the spokesperson said.\u00a0", "\"The fund has a well-established policy on environmental, social and governance matters and exclusions [that]\u00a0takes account of its objectives, legislation, investment strategy, Australian law and the treaties that the Australian government has entered and ratified.\"", "Australia's federal government has repeatedly criticised Myanmar's military junta and urged it to free political prisoners and restore democracy, but has resisted calls from civil society groups to impose fresh sanctions on the military leadership."]
